GoCommons CLI
  • HOME
  • GETTING STARTED
  • HELP
  • VIEW ON GITHUB

A Golang library to implement simple to complex command line applications with multiple subcommand support and built in REPL terminal

VIEW ON GITHUB Getting Started

GoCommons CLI Features

Let's see why GoCommon CLI is better than other CLI libraries…

Great subcommand support

Ever seen applications like git which supports multiple subcommands like git clone and git push? Well, now you can build you own myawesomeapp supporting multiple subcommands foo and bar effortlessly using this library

Full blown REPL terminal built in

Run your app without providing a subcommand and you get a builtin internal REPL terminal with full history, configurable prompt, keyboard shortcuts and autocompletion

Complete bash shortcuts supported in the REPL terminal

All the keyboard shortcuts that you are familiar with - up and down arrows, Ctrl-p, Ctrl-n to navigate between history, Ctrl-a, Ctrl-e and other text navigation shortcuts work out of the box

Supports colors in terminal

Build command line applications that supports displaying text in multiple colors, bold, italics, blinking with the colors package

Supports custom themes

Don't like the default colors? Create your own with Themes package

Marketing fluff

Because every website needs to have pretty font-awesome icons and some text underneath them


Great Code Coverage

Large number of unit tests with great code coverage should provide your manager peace of mind

Easy to code and ship

Create one struct per subcommand and implement the Run() method. easy peasy.

Easy to get help

We are available via email, twitter and slack.

Made with Love

Because it is mandatory to include 'Made with Love'

Continous Integration

Every git push and every pull request goes though go vet, go fmt and go test checks before getting merged to master

Extensibility

All modules are written as Interfaces. If you dont like the current implementation, create your own.

Higly Themeable

Don't like the default look and feel? Change it via the themes package.

Permissive License

MIT License. Go wild.

Interested to know more?


Start with the Getting started guide

Then take a look at the demo applicationDemo Application
